frameDefinitions: The universe is considered through a teleological perspective and natural phenomena are seen to exist for the purpose of fulfilling some ultimate aim.
A Speaker communicates a message stating an Item's membership in a Category, i.e., asserts that the Item has the defining characteristics of the Category.
An Agent causes a Firearm to discharge which induces the rapid motion of the Projectile.
In this frame a Deformer deforms a Patient possibly against a Resistant_surface such that it undergoes a shape-change from its canonical or original shape into the Configuration, a new shape.
An  Agent or non-human Cause causes an Item to change its physical size.
An Agent or Cause causes an Entity to change, either in its category membership or in terms of the value of an Attribute.
frameExamples: The <t>PURPOSE</t> of the sun is to provide energy
He <t>depicted</t> his involvement as merely peripheral.
The bank robber <t>shot</t> at the clerks with an AK-47.
Ellen <t>crumpled</t> the paper into a ball.
If the design crashes too often, then try <t>lengthening</t> the wings by a few centimeters, to perhaps 30cm total.  CNI INI
Our storylines follows the saga outlined by the Ultima Series, but we have <t>modified</t> it in order to make our writing more cohesive.
listRoleDefinitions: An entity that was not created by a living thing that is conceptualized to exist to fulfill some <fen>Goal</fen>.
The ultimate aim of the <fen>Apparatus</fen>.
The individual that communicates the message concerning the <fen>Category</fen> of an <fen>Item</fen>.
The class of entities with characteristics that match those of the <fen>Item</fen> according to the portrayal of the <fen>Speaker</fen>.
The entity that the <fen>Speaker</fen> portrays as belonging to a <fen>Category</fen>.
The piece of text in which a <fen>Speaker</fen> communicates their categorization of the <fen>Item</fen>.
The point in time at which the <fen>Speaker</fen> makes a characterization of the <fen>Item</fen>.
The location at which the <fen>Speaker</fen> characterizes the <fen>Item</fen>
The entity whose rapid, dangerous motion is caused by the Agent and/or Firearm.
The Agent is the person performing the intentional act causing the motion of the Projectile.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the shooting event takes place.
The location in which the shooting event takes place.
The <fen>Deformer</fen> is the one who does the reshaping.
The <fen>Patient</fen> is the entity acted on and that undergoes a change.
The <fen>Cause</fen> is an animate or inanimate entity, a force, or event that produces an effect. Volitionality is not a necessary characteristic of <fen>Cause</fen>s.
A state that holds of the <fen>Patient</fen> or a relation that holds among the constituent parts of the <fen>Patient</fen> as a result of the arranging action.
The role <fen>Time</fen> identifies when the <fen>Deformer</fen> intentionally affects the <fen>Patient</fen>.
The <fen>Place</fen> indicates where the <fen>Deformer</fen> intentionally affects the <fen>Patient</fen>.
With some words in this frame, an <fen>Agent</fen> who causes the change in size of the <fen>Item</fen> may be present. The <fen>Agent</fen> typically occurs as the External Argument of a verb.
The <fen>Item</fen> is frequently the External Argument of verbs or the NP Object if an <fen>Agent</fen> is expressed.
The <fen>Cause</fen> is a non-human entity which brings about the change in size.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Agent</fen> causes the <fen>Item</fen> to expand.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Agent</fen> cause the expansion of the <fen>Item</fen>.
The sentient entity that effects a change in the <fen>Entity</fen>.
The category of which the <fen>Entity</fen> is a member before the <fen>Agent</fen> causes a change.
The category that the <fen>Entity</fen> belongs to after it has undergone the change.
The value that the <fen>Attribute</fen> assumes as a result of the change that the <fen>Entity</fen> is caused to undergo.
The value that the <fen>Attribute</fen> has before the change takes place.
A characteristic of the <fen>Entity</fen> for which a value can be assigned or determined by calculation, measurement , or observation.
The abstract or concrete thing or situation that the <fen>Agent</fen> causes to change.
An event that causes a change in the <fen>Entity</fen>.
The time at which the change of the <fen>Entity</fen> is caused.
The location where the change of the <fen>Entity</fen> is caused.
listRoleExamples: However, <fex>'A Brief History of Medicine'</fex> characterizes influenza as the most deadly plague, overall.
The robbers shot at the clerks <fex>as they ran out of the bank</fex>
The bankrobbers were crazy enough to shoot at the clerks with an AK-47 <fex>inside the bank</fex>
<fex>The lieutenant</fex> crushed it angrily with his boot before looking back at Hencke.
Jack plucked the flower out of his morning coat and closed his fist slowly over it , crushing <fex>it</fex> into a pulp.
<fex>The strong winds</fex> deformed the structure of the outhouse.
The lieutenant crushed it angrily with his boot <fex>before looking back at Hencke</fex>.
<fex>The system administrator</fex> changed the value from 'KDE' to 'GNOME', and then restarted the system.
Her time with the Healer Craft has changed her <fex>from a shy, nervous young girl</fex> into a confident (almost) young woman
The radical message of the cross transformed Saul of Tarsus and changed him from a persecutor of Christians <fex>to a tender believer</fex>.
We changed the size from 8 1/2x11 <fex>to a larger 11 x 17</fex> and gave it a complete graphical makeover.
My dad changed his hair color <fex>from red</fex>  to blue today.
We changed <fex>the price</fex> from $1.26 to $1.27 per pint.
The recent terrorist attacks had changed <fex>the political climate</fex>.
<fex>Major technological innovations</fex> changed the social and economic conditions.
He changed it <fex>after David Bowie told him that only twerps have the same first and last name</fex>.
<fex>In his own room</fex> he had modified nothing.
